revised_title: Sulphur Bacteria: The Key Players in the Anaerobic Oxidation of Organic Matter
tldr: This article discusses the role of sulphur bacteria in the anaerobic oxidation of organic matter. It highlights the different capacities of sulphate-reducing bacteria to degrade organic compounds and their significance in terminal oxidation. The article also introduces new species of sulphate-reducing bacteria that can oxidize acetate and other organic compounds, making them essential for the complete oxidation of organic matter in sulphate-sufficient environments.
